link_desc:
If you have two Oracle Database Servers running in your environment, 1 as Master and the other one as Standby (DR) and you don't have Data Guard activated/available, you'll need to manually monitor your databases.

This Script monitors the difference between the Master and the Standby Oracle DB, by checking on both servers the latest Archiving Log applied.

You can then have it a historical data on your Zabbix, set up triggers in case your Slave is too behind, as well as auctions.

The plugin was tested on Zabbix 3.0, 3.2 and 3.4 server.
tags: oracle, oracledb, oracle replication, archiving logs, databases, dbs
author: Lucas Possamai
